template.template: Template OS Linux CPU by Zabbix agent
template.name: Template OS Linux CPU by Zabbix agent

item.name: CPU idle time
item.description: The time the CPU has spent doing nothing.

item.name: CPU system time
item.description: The time the CPU has spent running the kernel and its processes.

item.name: CPU user time
item.description: The time the CPU has spent running users' processes that are not niced.

item.name: CPU nice time
item.description: The time the CPU has spent running users' processes that have been niced.

item.name: CPU iowait time
item.description: Amount of time the CPU has been waiting for I/O to complete.

item.name: CPU steal time
item.description: The amount of CPU 'stolen' from this virtual machine by the hypervisor for other tasks (such as running another virtual machine).

item.name: CPU interrupt time
item.description: The amount of time the CPU has been servicing hardware interrupts.

item.name: CPU softirq time
item.description: The amount of time the CPU has been servicing software interrupts.

item.name: CPU guest time
item.description: Guest time (time spent running a virtual CPU for a guest operating system)

item.name: CPU guest nice time
item.description: Time spent running a niced guest (virtual CPU for guest operating systems under the control of the Linux kernel)

template.template: Template OS Linux filesystems by Zabbix agent
template.name: Template OS Linux filesystems by Zabbix agent

discovery_rule.name: Mounted filesystem discovery
discovery_rule.description: Discovery of file systems of different types.

trigger_prototype.expression: {Template OS Linux filesystems by Zabbix agent:vfs.fs.size[{#FSNAME},pused].last()}>{$VFS.FS.PUSED.MAX.CRIT:"{#FSNAME}"} and (({Template OS Linux filesystems by Zabbix agent:vfs.fs.size[{#FSNAME},total].last()}-{Template OS Linux filesystems by Zabbix agent:vfs.fs.size[{#FSNAME},used].last()})<5G or {Template OS Linux filesystems by Zabbix agent:vfs.fs.size[{#FSNAME},pused].timeleft(1h,,100)}<1d)
trigger_prototype.name: {#FSNAME}: Disk space is critically low (used > {$VFS.FS.PUSED.MAX.CRIT:"{#FSNAME}"})
trigger_prototype.description: Last value: {ITEM.LASTVALUE1}. Space used: {ITEM.VALUE3} of {ITEM.VALUE2} ({ITEM.VALUE1}), time left till full: < 24h. Two conditions should match: First, space utilization should be above {$VFS.FS.PUSED.MAX.CRIT:"{#FSNAME}"}. Second condition should be one of the following: - The disk free space is less than 5G. - The disk will be full in less than 24hours.

trigger_prototype.expression: {Template OS Linux filesystems by Zabbix agent:vfs.fs.size[{#FSNAME},pused].last()}>{$VFS.FS.PUSED.MAX.WARN:"{#FSNAME}"} and (({Template OS Linux filesystems by Zabbix agent:vfs.fs.size[{#FSNAME},total].last()}-{Template OS Linux filesystems by Zabbix agent:vfs.fs.size[{#FSNAME},used].last()})<10G or {Template OS Linux filesystems by Zabbix agent:vfs.fs.size[{#FSNAME},pused].timeleft(1h,,100)}<1d)
trigger_prototype.name: {#FSNAME}: Disk space is low (used > {$VFS.FS.PUSED.MAX.WARN:"{#FSNAME}"})
trigger_prototype.description: Last value: {ITEM.LASTVALUE1}. Space used: {ITEM.VALUE3} of {ITEM.VALUE2} ({ITEM.VALUE1}), time left till full: < 24h. Two conditions should match: First, space utilization should be above {$VFS.FS.PUSED.MAX.CRIT:"{#FSNAME}"}. Second condition should be one of the following: - The disk free space is less than 10G. - The disk will be full in less than 24hours.

dependency.name: {#FSNAME}: Disk space is critically low (used > {$VFS.FS.PUSED.MAX.CRIT:"{#FSNAME}"})
dependency.expression: {Template OS Linux filesystems by Zabbix agent:vfs.fs.size[{#FSNAME},pused].last()}>{$VFS.FS.PUSED.MAX.CRIT:"{#FSNAME}"} and (({Template OS Linux filesystems by Zabbix agent:vfs.fs.size[{#FSNAME},total].last()}-{Template OS Linux filesystems by Zabbix agent:vfs.fs.size[{#FSNAME},used].last()})<5G or {Template OS Linux filesystems by Zabbix agent:vfs.fs.size[{#FSNAME},pused].timeleft(1h,,100)}<1d)

trigger_prototype.name: {#FSNAME}: Running out of free inodes (free < {$VFS.FS.INODE.PFREE.MIN.CRIT:"{#FSNAME}"}%)
trigger_prototype.description: Last value: {ITEM.LASTVALUE1}. It may become impossible to write to disk if there are no index nodes left. As symptoms, 'No space left on device' or 'Disk is full' errors may be seen even though free space is available.

trigger_prototype.name: {#FSNAME}: Running out of free inodes (free < {$VFS.FS.INODE.PFREE.MIN.WARN:"{#FSNAME}"}%)
trigger_prototype.description: Last value: {ITEM.LASTVALUE1}. It may become impossible to write to disk if there are no index nodes left. As symptoms, 'No space left on device' or 'Disk is full' errors may be seen even though free space is available.

item.host: Template OS Linux filesystems by Zabbix agent
Template OS Linux filesystems by Zabbix agent

template.template: Template OS Linux memory by Zabbix agent
template.name: Template OS Linux memory by Zabbix agent

item.name: Available memory
item.description: Available memory, in Linux, available = free + buffers + cache. On other platforms calculation may vary. See also: https://www.zabbix.com/documentation/current/manual/appendix/items/vm.memory.size_params

template.template: Template OS Linux block devices by Zabbix agent
template.name: Template OS Linux block devices by Zabbix agent

item_prototype.name: {#DEVNAME}: Disk read rate
item_prototype.description: r/s. The number (after merges) of read requests completed per second for the device.

item_prototype.name: {#DEVNAME}: Disk write rate
item_prototype.description: w/s. The number (after merges) of write requests completed per second for the device.

item_prototype.name: {#DEVNAME}: Disk read time (rate)
item_prototype.description: Rate of total read time counter. Used in r_await calculation

item_prototype.name: {#DEVNAME}: Disk write time (rate)
item_prototype.description: Rate of total write time counter. Used in w_await calculation

item_prototype.name: {#DEVNAME}: Disk read request avg waiting time (r_await)
item_prototype.description: This formula contains two boolean expressions that evaluates to 1 or 0 in order to set calculated metric to zero and to avoid division by zero exception.

item_prototype.name: {#DEVNAME}: Disk write request avg waiting time (w_await)
item_prototype.description: This formula contains two boolean expressions that evaluates to 1 or 0 in order to set calculated metric to zero and to avoid division by zero exception.

trigger_prototype.expression: {Template OS Linux block devices by Zabbix agent:vfs.dev.read.await[{#DEVNAME}].min(5m)} > {$VFS.DEV.READ.AWAIT.WARN:"{#DEVNAME}"} or {Template OS Linux block devices by Zabbix agent:vfs.dev.read.await[{#DEVNAME}].min(5m)} > {$VFS.DEV.WRITE.AWAIT.WARN:"{#DEVNAME}"}
trigger_prototype.name: {#DEVNAME}: Disk read request response are too high (read > {$VFS.DEV.READ.AWAIT.WARN:"{#DEVNAME}"} ms for 5m or write > {$VFS.DEV.WRITE.AWAIT.WARN:"{#DEVNAME}"} ms for 5m)
trigger_prototype.description: Last value: {ITEM.LASTVALUE1}. This trigger might indicate disk {#DEVNAME} saturation.

item.host: Template OS Linux block devices by Zabbix agent
Template OS Linux block devices by Zabbix agent
Template OS Linux block devices by Zabbix agent
Template OS Linux block devices by Zabbix agent

template.template: Template OS Linux network interfaces by Zabbix agent
template.name: Template OS Linux network interfaces by Zabbix agent

discovery_rule.name: Network interface discovery
discovery_rule.description: Discovery of network interfaces as defined in global regular expression "Network interfaces for discovery". Filtering veth interfaces automatically created by Docker.

item_prototype.name: Interface {#IFNAME}: Operational status
item_prototype.description: Indicates the interface RFC2863 operational state as a string. Possible values are:"unknown", "notpresent", "down", "lowerlayerdown", "testing","dormant", "up". Reference: https://www.kernel.org/doc/Documentation/ABI/testing/sysfs-class-net

item_prototype.name: Interface {#IFNAME}: Interface type
item_prototype.description: Indicates the interface protocol type as a decimal value. See include/uapi/linux/if_arp.h for all possible values. Reference: https://www.kernel.org/doc/Documentation/ABI/testing/sysfs-class-net

trigger_prototype.expression: {Template OS Linux network interfaces by Zabbix agent:net.if.in["{#IFNAME}",errors].avg(5m)}>{$IF_ERRORS_WARN:"{#IFNAME}"} or {Template OS Linux network interfaces by Zabbix agent:net.if.out["{#IFNAME}",errors].avg(5m)}>{$IF_ERRORS_WARN:"{#IFNAME}"}
trigger_prototype.recovery_expression: {Template OS Linux network interfaces by Zabbix agent:net.if.in["{#IFNAME}",errors].avg(5m)}<{$IF_ERRORS_WARN:"{#IFNAME}"}*0.8 and {Template OS Linux network interfaces by Zabbix agent:net.if.out["{#IFNAME}",errors].avg(5m)}<{$IF_ERRORS_WARN:"{#IFNAME}"}*0.8
trigger_prototype.name: Interface {#IFNAME}: High error rate
trigger_prototype.description: Last value: {ITEM.LASTVALUE1}. Recovers when below 80% of {$IF_ERRORS_WARN:"{#IFNAME}"} threshold

dependency.name: Interface {#IFNAME}: Link down
dependency.expression: {$IFCONTROL:"{#IFNAME}"}=1 and ({Template OS Linux network interfaces by Zabbix agent:vfs.file.contents["/sys/class/net/{#IFNAME}/operstate"].last()}=2 and {Template OS Linux network interfaces by Zabbix agent:vfs.file.contents["/sys/class/net/{#IFNAME}/operstate"].diff()}=1)
dependency.recovery_expression: {Template OS Linux network interfaces by Zabbix agent:vfs.file.contents["/sys/class/net/{#IFNAME}/operstate"].last()}<>2

trigger_prototype.expression: {$IFCONTROL:"{#IFNAME}"}=1 and ({Template OS Linux network interfaces by Zabbix agent:vfs.file.contents["/sys/class/net/{#IFNAME}/operstate"].last()}=2 and {Template OS Linux network interfaces by Zabbix agent:vfs.file.contents["/sys/class/net/{#IFNAME}/operstate"].diff()}=1)
trigger_prototype.recovery_expression: {Template OS Linux network interfaces by Zabbix agent:vfs.file.contents["/sys/class/net/{#IFNAME}/operstate"].last()}<>2
trigger_prototype.name: Interface {#IFNAME}: Link down

trigger_prototype.expression: {Template OS Linux network interfaces by Zabbix agent:vfs.file.contents["/sys/class/net/{#IFNAME}/type"].change()}<0 and {Template OS Linux network interfaces by Zabbix agent:vfs.file.contents["/sys/class/net/{#IFNAME}/type"].last()}>0 and ({Template OS Linux network interfaces by Zabbix agent:vfs.file.contents["/sys/class/net/{#IFNAME}/type"].last()}=6 or {Template OS Linux network interfaces by Zabbix agent:vfs.file.contents["/sys/class/net/{#IFNAME}/type"].last()}=1) and ({Template OS Linux network interfaces by Zabbix agent:vfs.file.contents["/sys/class/net/{#IFNAME}/operstate"].last()}<>2)
trigger_prototype.recovery_expression: ({Template OS Linux network interfaces by Zabbix agent:vfs.file.contents["/sys/class/net/{#IFNAME}/type"].change()}>0 and {Template OS Linux network interfaces by Zabbix agent:vfs.file.contents["/sys/class/net/{#IFNAME}/type"].prev()}>0) or ({Template OS Linux network interfaces by Zabbix agent:vfs.file.contents["/sys/class/net/{#IFNAME}/operstate"].last()}=2)
trigger_prototype.name: Interface {#IFNAME}: Ethernet has changed to lower speed than it was before
trigger_prototype.description: Last value: {ITEM.LASTVALUE1}. This Ethernet connection has transitioned down from its known maximum speed. This might be a sign of autonegotiation issues. Ack to close.

dependency.name: Interface {#IFNAME}: Link down
dependency.expression: {$IFCONTROL:"{#IFNAME}"}=1 and ({Template OS Linux network interfaces by Zabbix agent:vfs.file.contents["/sys/class/net/{#IFNAME}/operstate"].last()}=2 and {Template OS Linux network interfaces by Zabbix agent:vfs.file.contents["/sys/class/net/{#IFNAME}/operstate"].diff()}=1)
dependency.recovery_expression: {Template OS Linux network interfaces by Zabbix agent:vfs.file.contents["/sys/class/net/{#IFNAME}/operstate"].last()}<>2

template.template: Template OS Linux by Zabbix agent
template.name: Template OS Linux by Zabbix agent
template.description:
Official Linux template. Requires agent of Zabbix 3.0.14, 3.4.5 and 4.0.0 or newer.
Known Issues:
Description: Network discovery. Zabbix agent as of 4.2 doesn't support items such as net.if.status, net.if.speed.
Template tooling version used: 0.27

trigger.expression: {Template OS Linux CPU by Zabbix agent:system.cpu.load[all,avg1].min(5m)}/{Template OS Linux CPU by Zabbix agent:system.cpu.num.last()}>{$LOAD_AVG_PER_CPU.MAX.WARN}
trigger.name: Load average is too high (per CPU load over {$LOAD_AVG_PER_CPU.MAX.WARN} for 5m)
trigger.description: Last value: {ITEM.LASTVALUE1}. Per CPU load average is too high. Your system may be slow to respond.

dependency.name: Load average is too high (per CPU load over {$LOAD_AVG_PER_CPU.MAX.WARN} for 5m)
dependency.expression: {Template OS Linux CPU by Zabbix agent:system.cpu.load[all,avg1].min(5m)}/{Template OS Linux CPU by Zabbix agent:system.cpu.num.last()}>{$LOAD_AVG_PER_CPU.MAX.WARN}

trigger.expression: {Template OS Linux memory by Zabbix agent:vm.memory.size[available].last(0)}<{$MEMORY_AVAILABLE_MIN} and {Template OS Linux memory by Zabbix agent:vm.memory.size[total].last(0)}>0
trigger.name: Lack of available memory ({ITEM.VALUE1} of {ITEM.VALUE2})

trigger.expression: {Template OS Linux memory by Zabbix agent:system.swap.size[,pfree].last()}<{$SWAP_PFREE_WARN} and {Template OS Linux memory by Zabbix agent:system.swap.size[,total].last()}>0
trigger.name: High swap space usage (free: {ITEM.VALUE1}, total: {ITEM.VALUE2})
trigger.description: Last value: {ITEM.LASTVALUE1}. This trigger is ignored, if there is no swap configured

trigger.name: {HOST.NAME} has been restarted (uptime < 10m)
trigger.description: Last value: {ITEM.LASTVALUE1}. The device uptime is less than 10 minutes
